alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 10:06PM EST until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky, southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Boyd, Carter and Lawrence. In southeast Ohio, Lawrence. In West Virginia, Boone, Cabell, Kanawha, Lincoln, Mason, Putnam and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 245 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1004 PM EST, Several reports of high water and road closures have be received this evening within the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen since this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charleston, Huntington, Nitro, Louisa, Winfield, Wayne, Hamlin, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Blaine, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Barboursville, Sissonville and Milton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
